poem:
"The Mercurial Magnate"

Croker, the paradox,
a boorish dance
of deals and decay

In the spangled globe of charisma, 
he spins - Trumpian in fiction, nuanced in hue.
His castle of cards crumbles,
framed by morning newsprint

Yet, the spectacle unwinds,
the sound and color unfolding,
into a sublime reflection,
on the mirror of our eyes.
